summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, detailing a discovery production. It lists materials being provided (including FBI documents, photos, videos, and police materials from Florida and New York) and discusses the status of data seized from Jeffrey Epstein's properties, noting privilege issues and limitations on what the prosecution and defense can access.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, recipient of this discovery letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The letter discusses discovery obligations related to her prosecution.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to data seized from his properties in New York and the Virgin Islands. His estate is asserting privilege over materials from seized electronic devices.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The signatory of the letter, representing the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, governing the handling of confidential discovery materials.

events.title: Discovery Production Letter Sent
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sent this letter to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel, detailing a production of discovery materials and outlining access to data from seized devices.

events.title: Discovery Deadline
events.description: The government's deadline to complete discovery production, by which it expects to produce responsive, non-privileged materials from seized electronic devices.

locations: Silvio J. Motto Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced a large volume of discovery materials (control numbers SDNY_GM_00328070 through SDNY_GM_00356148) to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, including FBI documents, photos, videos, and police materials from Florida and New York investigations.

Data was seized from multiple electronic devices at Jeffrey Epstein's properties in New York and the Virgin Islands, but a privilege review by Epstein's estate has prevented the prosecution and defense from accessing materials deemed privileged.

The government states that none of the seized electronic devices belonged to Ghislaine Maxwell, which legally restricts the prosecution team from providing the full set of non-privileged extracted data to the defense.

The government anticipates producing only materials responsive to the search warrants for the seized devices by November 9, 2020, and the prosecution team will also only have access to that responsive set.
